column5: Oats. Noodles. Kraft dinner.  Pudding mix. Soup mix.  Roe.  Anyone have a good chum for whities?  Lets hear it i need to nail some more of these suckers.
I actually dislike whitefish---so you can keep my limit  Over the years I heard Tapioaca (sp?)
Glen, where abouts are you heading out for whities?  If it's Simcoe you need to move until you find the active fish.   Once you have, no chum necessary.
someone told me cooked rice.   I have never tried it so can't comment on its effectiveness.
Up north here, very popular is cooked macaroni and rice  Works well
cooked barley
Thanks for the replies.  Do you add any flavor to the rice or barley?
crack cocaine
As Anders said cooked rice and noodles. My fav is a little roe tho....  TDunn
Nicely said. Better to be proactive than wait around for something that may never come.
Anywhere but simcoe.
cooked instant noodle
as anders and TDunn have said, I can vouch for cooked rice or macaroni. I personally use the macaroni.

It really just depends on what your whitefish are eating. Try to copy their natural diet the best you can.  If they have more of an insectivorous diet, noodles and rice and a bit of roe. If they have more of a piscivorous diet, salted minnows are you're best bet.
i use GARLIC!!!! works wonders! no word of a lie either. when the salmon start commin in they go pretty nuts for it too.
Do you just toss cloves down there or whats your trick? I know ive done the garlic powdered rice before.

On Simcoe, the whities move in ,and off thier feed.Small shell like clams or zebra mussels.Look for areas that will hold these.Mostly shoals and drop offs. As for baiting them, salties with eggshells in a dumping can,but ,no longer are salties allowed on Simcoe.

i chop it up the day before. you could do it JUST before you go too. sometimes i just throw it around for a few minutes of action  and sometimes i put it in a little roe sack sorta deal and attach a sinker and lower it into the water. when you throw the garlic around you may see a fish or two jump for it. i did that when the atlantics were commin in. was a pretty cool site!

Waay back in the day..80's and 90's there were  fishermen spamming the holes with cooked Barley, roe, egg shells and various other breakfast cereals.This was on Simcoe, long before the information highway.  Nowdays for me atleast it's cooked pasta and white rice on lakes other than Simcoe. I'ts pretty cool to watch the rice or pasta showers fall to the skittish whities on the electronics. At this time of year leftovers can make or break a successful whitie mission.  Late ice and ice-out whities go bannas....no need to chum/spam these toothless feeders.  Don't make put up the Betty White, polygrip commercial!!
Orzo
we bring my friend who always drinks too much...puke, nature's chum
LOL!
